Description: Axe-head: with a very wide cutting edge and perforated tangs. The middle tang is not truly centred and the mid-rib is more prominent on one face than the other. The blade is warped and one of the lateral tangs has been turned at the end. There are signs of wear on the cutting edge. The piece is quite thickly corroded. The line of the haft is visible on one of the lateral tangs.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (100)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
